info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 4:58PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A frontal passage with embedded strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Lewis and Clark, south central Pondera, northwestern Broadwater, northwestern Meagher, northeastern Jefferson, Teton, southwestern Chouteau and Cascade Counties through 545 PM MDT... At 457 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 18 miles northwest of Choteau to 6 miles east of Fort Shaw to 8 miles east of Montana City. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea sized hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Choteau, Cascade, East Helena, Fairfield, Dutton, Fort Shaw, Montana City, Brady, Black Eagle, Fort Shaw, Power, Floweree, York, Eden, Stockett, First Peoples Buffalo Jump State Park, Winston, Ulm and Goose Bay. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
